tier_1_determinative.sexual_act_description: The accused committed rape upon the child victim in a room in his house.
tier_1_determinative.absence_of_consent: The child victim was a 9-year-old girl, indicating her inability to give legal consent.

tier_2_material.aggravated_circumstances_of_rape: The rape was followed by the murder of the child victim, and the act was committed by the accused who was alone with the victim.
tier_2_material.relationship_to_accused: The child victim was a friend of the daughter of the accused.

tier_3_contextual.incident_location: The incident occurred in the house of the accused, situated on the side of the panchayat road at Ponnamkallu, Amarambalam Village.
tier_3_contextual.time_of_reporting: The incident was reported on 4th April, 2012, at 7:00 pm. The delay in reporting was due to the initial efforts to trace the missing child.

tier_4_procedural.case_title: Abdul Nassar v. State of Kerala & Anr.
tier_4_procedural.appellant_or_petitioner: Abdul Nassar (legal heirs after his death)

residual_details.additional_facts: The prosecution presented evidence including DNA matching the accused with semen found on the victim's clothing, and multiple pieces of circumstantial evidence linking the accused to the crime scene. The trial court initially sentenced the accused to death, which was confirmed by the High Court. The accused died during the pendency of the appeal, and his legal heirs continued the appeal to clear his name.
